parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ana and pauo; to repose (be exempt), remain); by implication, to refresh.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably strengthened from splen; an intestine; figuratively, pity or sympathy.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
